snippet: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates have shifted most of their aircraft away from Syria as they fight Houthi rebels in Yemen.
abstract: Arab allies who initially pledged to support United States against Islamic State in Syria appear to have largely disappeared as American airstrikes escalate; have quietly left United States to carry out assault as they focus their attention elsewhere, primarily on battling Houthi-backed militants in Yemen.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Qatar, and Michael R. Gordon from Erbil, Iraq. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates have shifted most of their aircraft away from Syria as they fight Houthi rebels in Yemen.

headline.main: As U.S. Escalates Air War on ISIS, Allies Slip Away
headline.print_headline: As U.S. Escalates Air War on ISIS, Allies Fade Away

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
